intro: Eriosorus hispidulus, commonly known as the hairy spleenworts, is a species of moss belonging to the family Pterobryaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, leafy structure with a distinctive hairy appearance on its stems and leaves. This moss typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its leaves are usually elongated and slightly curled, contributing to its unique aesthetic. Eriosorus hispidulus plays a vital role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its native habitats.
